array.string:
I see you think of yourself as an expert! First question...What is the F-ratio?
A. The ratio of variation of individual differences to experimental effects B. The grand variance between all the scores, regardless of condition C. The ratio of experimental effect to the individual differences

Question 2: When should you use Factorial ANOVA?
A. When you have two or more dependent variables B. When you have two or more independent variables C. When participants participate in all conditions of an experiment

Question 3: What are orthogonal contrasts?
A. Independent contrasts B. Contrasts whose p-values are correlated C. Contrasts that contain the placebo group

Question 4: The effect size in a population is instrinsically linked to which statistical property?
A. Orthogonal contrasts B. The standard deviation C. The alpha value
